trans-unit.source: This section shows you how to install a SQL Server Express, enable TCP/IP, set a static port, and create a database that can be used with Hybrid Connections.
trans-unit.target: This section shows you how to install a SQL Server Express, enable TCP/IP, set a static port, and create a database that can be used with Hybrid Connections.

trans-unit.source: Install SQL Server Express
trans-unit.target: Install SQL Server Express

trans-unit.source: To use an on-premises SQL Server or SQL Server Express database with a hybrid connection, TCP/IP needs to be enabled on a static port.
trans-unit.target: To use an on-premises SQL Server or SQL Server Express database with a hybrid connection, TCP/IP needs to be enabled on a static port.

trans-unit.source: Default instances on SQL Server use static port 1433, whereas named instances do not.
trans-unit.target: Default instances on SQL Server use static port 1433, whereas named instances do not.

trans-unit.source: Because of this, we will install the default instance.
trans-unit.target: Because of this, we will install the default instance.

trans-unit.source: If you already have the default instance of SQL Server Express installed, you can skip this section.
trans-unit.target: If you already have the default instance of SQL Server Express installed, you can skip this section.

trans-unit.source: To install SQL Server Express, run the **SQLEXPRWT_x64_ENU.exe** or **SQLEXPR_x86_ENU.exe** file that you downloaded.
trans-unit.target: To install SQL Server Express, run the **SQLEXPRWT_x64_ENU.exe** or **SQLEXPR_x86_ENU.exe** file that you downloaded.

trans-unit.source: The SQL Server Installation Center wizard appears.
trans-unit.target: The SQL Server Installation Center wizard appears.

trans-unit.source: Choose **New SQL Server stand-alone installation or add features to an existing installation**, follow the instructions, accepting the default choices and settings, until you get to the **Instance Configuration** page.
trans-unit.target: Choose **New SQL Server stand-alone installation or add features to an existing installation**, follow the instructions, accepting the default choices and settings, until you get to the **Instance Configuration** page.

trans-unit.source: On the **Instance Configuration** page, choose **Default instance**, then accept the default settings on the **Server Configuration** page.
trans-unit.target: On the **Instance Configuration** page, choose **Default instance**, then accept the default settings on the **Server Configuration** page.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]If you already have a default instance of SQL Server installed, you can skip to the next section and use this instance with Hybrid Connections.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]If you already have a default instance of SQL Server installed, you can skip to the next section and use this instance with Hybrid Connections.

trans-unit.source: On the **Database Engine Configuration** page, under **Authentication Mode**, choose **Mixed Mode (SQL Server authentication and Windows authentication)**, and provide a secure password for the built-in **sa** administrator account.
trans-unit.target: On the **Database Engine Configuration** page, under **Authentication Mode**, choose **Mixed Mode (SQL Server authentication and Windows authentication)**, and provide a secure password for the built-in **sa** administrator account.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you will be using SQL Server authentication.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you will be using SQL Server authentication.

trans-unit.source: Be sure to remember the password that you provide, because you will need it later.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to remember the password that you provide, because you will need it later.

trans-unit.source: Finish the wizard to complete the installation.
trans-unit.target: Finish the wizard to complete the installation.

trans-unit.source: Enable TCP/IP and setting a static port
trans-unit.target: Enable TCP/IP and setting a static port

trans-unit.source: This section uses SQL Server Configuration Manager, which was installed when you installed SQL Server Express, to enable TCP/IP and set a static IP address.
trans-unit.target: This section uses SQL Server Configuration Manager, which was installed when you installed SQL Server Express, to enable TCP/IP and set a static IP address.

trans-unit.source: Follow the steps in [Enable TCP/IP Network Protocol for SQL Server](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh231672%28v=sql.110%29.aspx) to enable TCP/IP access to the instance.
trans-unit.target: Follow the steps in [Enable TCP/IP Network Protocol for SQL Server](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh231672%28v=sql.110%29.aspx) to enable TCP/IP access to the instance.

trans-unit.source: (Optional) If you are not able to use the default instance, you must follow the steps in [Configure a Server to Listen on a Specific TCP Port ](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms177440.aspx) to set a static port for the instance.
trans-unit.target: (Optional) If you are not able to use the default instance, you must follow the steps in [Configure a Server to Listen on a Specific TCP Port ](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ms177440.aspx) to set a static port for the instance.

trans-unit.source: If you complete this step, you will connect using the new port that you define, instead of port 1433.
trans-unit.target: If you complete this step, you will connect using the new port that you define, instead of port 1433.

trans-unit.source: (Optional) If needed, add exceptions in the firewall to allow remote access to the SQL Server process (sqlservr.exe).
trans-unit.target: (Optional) If needed, add exceptions in the firewall to allow remote access to the SQL Server process (sqlservr.exe).

trans-unit.source: Create a new database in the on-premises SQL Server instance
trans-unit.target: Create a new database in the on-premises SQL Server instance

trans-unit.source: In SQL Server Management Studio, connect to the SQL Server you just installed.
trans-unit.target: In SQL Server Management Studio, connect to the SQL Server you just installed.

trans-unit.source: (If the **Connect to Server** dialog does not appear automatically, navigate to **Object Explorer** in the left pane, click **Connect**, and then click **Database Engine**.)
trans-unit.target: (If the **Connect to Server** dialog does not appear automatically, navigate to **Object Explorer** in the left pane, click **Connect**, and then click **Database Engine**.)

trans-unit.source: Connect to Server
trans-unit.target: Connect to Server

trans-unit.source: For **Server type**, choose **Database Engine**.
trans-unit.target: For **Server type**, choose **Database Engine**.

trans-unit.source: For **Server name**, you can use **localhost** or the name of the computer where you installed SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: For **Server name**, you can use **localhost** or the name of the computer where you installed SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: Choose **SQL Server authentication**, and supply the password for the sa login that you created earlier.
trans-unit.target: Choose **SQL Server authentication**, and supply the password for the sa login that you created earlier.

trans-unit.source: To create a new database by using SQL Server Management Studio, right-click **Databases** in Object Explorer, and then click **New Database**.
trans-unit.target: To create a new database by using SQL Server Management Studio, right-click **Databases** in Object Explorer, and then click **New Database**.

trans-unit.source: In the **New Database** dialog, type `OnPremisesDB`, and then click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: In the **New Database** dialog, type `OnPremisesDB`, and then click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: In Object Explorer, if you expand **Databases**, you will see that the new database is created.
trans-unit.target: In Object Explorer, if you expand **Databases**, you will see that the new database is created.
